title: Explained: What happened in deadly Beirut explosion
description:
The size of the explosion that ripped through the port in the Lebanese capital Beirut has shocked the world.

Some 300,000 people have been left homeless, at least 130 were killed and thousands have been injured.

But what do we know about where and how it happened?

Scripted, produced and edited by Rami Abukalam, Adam Parker and Victoria Elms
Voiced by Ashish Joshi 

Satellite imagery: Planet Labs Inc

title: The shocking centre of the COVID-19 crisis
description:
The crisis gripping the town at the centre of the global COVID-19 crisis in Italy has been witnessed by Sky News' Chief Correspondent Stuart Ramsay.

After this video was aired, Italy's foreign minister urged everyone to watch it.

"I urge you all to watch this report made by Sky News, a video that is being shared around the world," said Luigi Di Maio.

"It shows what is happening in Bergamo hospital, one of the hardest hit by this emergency.  

"I repeat: Stay at home."

title: Stuck at sea: Cargo ship wedged in Suez Canal causes traffic jam
description:
Tug boats and a digger are struggling to free a mega cargo ship, blocking one of the world's busiest shipping pathways.

Dozens of ships are stuck because a container ship almost half a kilometre long is wedged across the waterway.

Listen to the Sky News Daily podcast on the impact of the cargo ship's blockage of the Suez Canal - https://news.sky.com/story/wedged-in-the-suez-how-a-mega-ship-brought-the-canal-to-a-standstill-12261097

title: Russia's Putin: The US is parking missiles "on the porch of our house"
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin has told Sky News that the US and NATO are expanding onto Russia's borders - and not the other way around. 

At his traditional end of year news conference, Mr Putin answered questions from the world's media. And he told Sky News' Russia Correspondent Diana Magnay that his country wasn't threatening anybody and that he didn't want conflict in Ukraine. But he said the ball "is in the West's court". 

Watch their exchange here in full.

title: Fly With RAF's Quick Reaction Alert Crews
description:
In this special report, Sky News gains exclusive access to the RAF's Quick Reaction Alert (QRA) squad.

Based at RAF Coningsby in Lincolnshire, the team is responsible for protecting Britain's skies and is ready to scramble, in Eurofighter Typhoon jets, at a moment's notice.

Defence Correspondent Alistair Bunkall goes inside the UK's top secret nuclear bunker and talks the pilots who would have to shoot down hostile aircraft.

title: Ukraine war: Captured medic's bodycam footage shows horror of Mariupol
description:
Footage filmed by a captured volunteer medic footage has shown the horrors taking place in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol after it was smuggled out in a tampon.

Using a body-worn camera, 53-year-old Yuliia Paievska recorded 256 gigabytes of video, documenting her team's frantic efforts over two weeks to save people from the brink of death.

Sky's Dominic Waghorn reports.

Keep up with all the latest developments in Ukraine on our liveblog - https://qrcode.skynews.com/skynews/ukraineblog

#Russia #Ukraine #war #skynews

title: 9/11: How America’s worst terror attack unfolded
description:
On September 11, 2001, 2,973 people died and thousands were injured as two hi-jacked planes flew into the twin towers of the World Trade Center in New York City.
 
Twenty years later, the events of 9/11 continue to shape the US and the world.

title: Sky News Breakfast: Overnight fighting continues in Ukraine
description:
On Sky News Breakfast this Wednesday morning: 

- A seventh night of violence in Ukraine with 21 people reportedly killed and over 100 injured in shelling in the eastern city of Kharkiv;

- President Biden praises the bravery of the Ukrainians and the unity of the West in the face of Vladimir Putin's invasion;

- A huge convoy of Russian armoured vehicles is edging closer to the centre of Kyiv.

title: Ukraine Invasion: Russian nuclear deterrence forces put on high alert
description:
Vladimir Putin has ordered that Russia's nuclear deterrence forces are put on high alert.

The Russian president said aggressive statements by NATO leaders and economic sanctions against Moscow were behind the decision.

Ukraine and Russia are also set to hold negotiations at the Belarusian-Ukrainian border, according to the office of President Zelenskyy.

title: Ukraine crisis: More equipment arrives in Ukraine
description:
Britain says it will deploy troops to protect NATO allies in Europe if Russia invades Ukraine.

The Prime Minister told the House of Commons that Moscow would face ferocious Ukrainian resistance if the situation escalates and that NATO nations would stand together.

Russian forces have been performing for the cameras, while in Ukraine more equipment has been arriving from NATO countries.

title: Ukraine War: Captain of sunken Russian warship 'killed'
description:
Ukraine has claimed the captain of a Russian warship that was sunk in the Black Sea has been killed on board.  

Anton Gerashchenko, an adviser to Ukraine's ministry of internal affairs, shared the claim on Telegram saying that the ship's captain, Anton Kuprin, had died during an "explosion and fire on board".

description:
There were mixed reactions from crowds outside St Paul's Cathedral as the Royal Family turned out in full force for the Queen at the Jubilee Thanksgiving Service.

Both boos and cheers could be heard as Harry and Meghan made their way up the steps, in their first appearance with the family since they stepped away from Royal life.

title: Ukraine War:  Russian forces suffer heavy losses in the Donbas region
description:
Russian forces have intensified their efforts in the Donbas region in the east of the country.

But Ukraine says Vladimir Putin's soldiers are using heavy firepower around Donetsk, and have suffered severe losses in the disputed Luhansk region.

Sky's Special Correspondent Alex Crawford reports from there. 

Keep up with all the latest developments in Ukraine on our liveblog - https://qrcode.skynews.com/skynews/ukraineblog

title: Ukraine War: Finland poised to join NATO
description:
After decades of refusing to sign up, Finland has expressed their interest in joining NATO. 

The U-turn on public opinion of the military alliance came after the on-going war in Ukraine, which sparked fear against Russia - with whom the Finns share an 800km border.

title: Ukraine Invasion: Russian people start to feel the pinch of economic sanctions
description:
The economic consequences of the invasion are being felt hardest in Russia itself. 

Sanctions have thrown the economy into turmoil, and many international brands like Apple are now refusing to sell their products inside the country.

For many Russians, their way of life is changing, leaving them to question whether they want to remain in a pariah state.

title: 7/7 London Bombings: 10 Years On
description:
On July 7, 2005, terrorists detonated four bombs on London's transport network, killing 52 people.

The explosions - near Aldgate, Edgware Road and Russell Square Underground stations and on a bus in Tavistock Square - injured hundreds more.

A decade on from the 7/7 London bombings, this documentary looks at the stories of survival and bereavement in the aftermath of the tragic events.

title: Ukraine war: 'Smaller and smaller' Russian offensives
description:
Sky News' Security and Defence Analyst Michael Clarke says that Russian forces have now been freed-up from fighting in Mariupol, allowing them to deploy further west.

This allows them to take "small bite sized chunks" of territory, but without landing a strategic victory.

Russian units in Kherson have been trying to dislodge Ukrainian forces near Mykolaic, but progress appears to have stalled.

description:
Defence and Security Analyst Professor Michael Clarke says that Russian forces are "pinned in place" in the besieged city of Severodonetsk.

He says that the Russians are obsessed with the city over its "symbolic" importance, so Ukrainian forces are taking advantage of that and continuing the battle to protect two key cities further west.

title: Ukraine War: 'Russia has lost a third of their ground forces in Ukraine'
description:
Ed Arnold, former British Army Officer and Research Fellow at the Royal United Services Institute has more on the situation in Ukraine. 

He said the battle is "effectively over" in Kharkiv, and that Ukraine has won the fight in the city.

The UK Ministry of Defence has said that Russia has "lost a third of their forces deployed in Ukraine" and is "unlikely to accelerate their rate of advance in the next 30 days."

Their latest statement came as Russia's offensive in Donbas "lost momentum" and has "fallen significantly behind schedule."

People were forced to walk through fields while explosives fell all around them.

Defence and Security analyst Michael Clarke takes a closer look at why Finland and Sweden feel the need to firm up their security.

title: Ukraine War: Russia fires hypersonic missile
description:
Russia has used a much-talked about 'invisible' missile against Ukraine for the first time.

The Kinzhal hypersonic missile travels between five and 10 times the speed of sound, which means it is impossible to defend against, said military expert Prof Michael Clarke.

"These missiles were developed for the prospect of apocalyptic war between the superpowers," he said.

title: Ukraine War: All eyes on the Donbas as Germany sends tanks to help Ukraine
description:
Russian troops have secured the land bridge from Crimea to the Donbas, which will prove difficult for Ukraine to take back. In April, Germany committed tanks to the war in Ukraine with 15 set to arrive in July.

The British foreign secretary, Liz Truss, has said she thinks Britain should be prepared to send weapons to Moldova, which neighbours Ukraine to the South West.

Keep up with all the latest developments in Ukraine on our liveblog - https://qrcode.skynews.com/skynews/ukraineblog

title: Ukraine War: HIMARS rocket system used to strike Russian ammunition depots
description:
Defence and Security Analyst Professor Michael Clarke looks at the HIMARS mobile rocket systems which Ukrainian forces used to hit a Russian ammunition depot, causing one of the biggest explosions in the war so far.

Prof Clarke says the HIMARS are causing many problems for Russian forces because they can't locate them.

title: Suez Canal traffic moves after vessel is refloated
description:
Maritime traffic in Egypt's Suez Canal is moving again after a stranded container ship, which had blocked one of the world's most important waterways for six days, was freed.

The Ever Given ship was successfully refloated by salvage experts allowing the shipping route between Europe and Asia to be re-opened.

title: Ukraine War: Russia 'scraping the barrel in terms of deploying equipment'
description:
Veteran British Army tank commander Justin Crump talks through the 'interesting compromise' on the evacuation of Mariupol.

The Russians are now 'focusing on Donetsk', he says, which is illustrated by their deployment of BMPTs, a vehicle designed to support tanks, which they don't have many of.
